intro: Heterorhachis spinosissima, commonly known as the spiny heterorhachis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
